availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William L. Owens (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and blacksmith.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married to Wilmoth Lofton Owens. Father of Marshall Owens, William Owens, Permelia Owens, Christopher Columbus Owens, Rebecca Owens, Sarah E. Owens, Alfred Owens, William M. Owens, Ardella Owens, Ardora Owens, and John Owens. Farmer in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Rockcastle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Southern District, p. 165A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 489.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, District 1, p. 1A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994053, Rockcastle County Births.
Mount Vernon Signal (Mount Vernon, KY), September 18, 1908, p. 3.
"William L Owens (1828-1908)," Find A Grave, Memorial 167321773, accessed October 13, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/167321773.
